content.question: A researcher is studying the effect of genetically modified <math alttext="open parenthesis, G M, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GM</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> and nongenetically modified <math alttext="open parenthesis, n G M, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mtext>nGM</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> corn on the weight gain of lambs. The sex and genetics of the lambs can affect their weight gain. Five sets of male twin lambs and five sets of female twin lambs—for a total of twenty lambs—are available for the study. The lambs will be randomly assigned to a diet of either <math alttext="genetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> or <math alttext="nongenetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>nGM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> diet of corn. Weight gain will be recorded for each lamb after five weeks on the diet. Which of the following designs would be best to use in the study?

choices.label: A completely randomized design. Randomly assign ten lambs to the <math alttext="genetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> diet and ten lambs to the <math alttext="nongenetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>nGM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> diet.

A stratified randomized design. Divide the lambs into males and females. Within each group, randomly assign the <math alttext="genetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> diet to one half and the <math alttext="nongenetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>nGM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> diet to the other half.

A randomized block design. Randomly assign ten lambs to the <math alttext="genetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> diet and ten lambs to the <math alttext="nongenetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>nGM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> diet.

A randomized block design. Randomly assign the <math alttext="genetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> diet to the male lambs and the <math alttext="nongenetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>nGM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> diet to the female lambs.

A matched pairs design. For each set of twins, randomly assign one twin to the <math alttext="genetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> diet and the other twin to the <math alttext="nongenetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>nGM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> diet.

content.answer: A matched pairs design. For each set of twins, randomly assign one twin to the <math alttext="genetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> diet and the other twin to the <math alttext="nongenetically modified" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>nGM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> diet.
